Telephone
Midway 5-5565
February 19, I960
Harold Hill, Administrative Vice President, NAEB
lit Gregory Hall
University of Illinois I960
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harolds
Enclosed is a sample of the letter I am goi§g to send out
to the various school program people around the country.
I am also enclosing an information sheet on the project.
I will start these letters on their way next week. If
you see any changes that should be made in either the
letter or information sheet, let me know.
I still have not had any official notification from
Superintendent Willis that we can use the Chicago
material. My conversations with Liz Marshall have
indicated that it will be all right but we do need some
official recognition of the project. I also have not
heard from George Jennings, but as you saw, I have
written to him also.
Last week I sent out letters to all of the utilization
committee members. I included a project outline with
this letter and asked for their help in locating various
places where kits might be developed. It is too soon
to have any answer from this series of letters•
I received the information relative to the USOE contract
proposals. Since thepe are still a few questions in my
mind, I have placed a call to McPherson in Washington but
have not tracked him down yet. If there is a March 1st
deadline, I want to find out from him what he would like
to have in addition to the proposal form already in his
hand. For instance, there is no budget breakdown or
time table included in the original outline. I will try
to find out what kind of supporting information he will
need and I will see that he gets it. If you have any
follow-up on the material you sent me on the 11th, drop
it in the mail.
